snippet: The journalist was interrogated Sunday about his article on an alleged coup plot by military officers and then was moved to a secret detention center.
abstract: Military prosecutors in Egypt extend detention of Hossam Bahgat, activist and investigative journalist who reported on convictions of 26 military officers accused of treason; extension signals government is ready to bring Bahgat to trial for publishing false news harmful to national security.

byline.contributor: David Kirkpatrick contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The journalist was interrogated Sunday about his article on an alleged coup plot by military officers and then was moved to a secret detention center.

headline.main: Egypt Extends Detention of a Journalist, Hossam Bahgat
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Middle East; Egypt: Reporter’s Detention Extended, Heightening Concerns About Rights

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
